description: This project combines the simplicity of Tkinter (v8.6) for the graphical interface with the power of pdf2docx (v0.5.8) to convert .pdf to .docx offline, ensuring your data stays on your machine and avoiding formatting or information loss.

whats_pdftoword: PDF2WORDX is the ultimate tool for converting PDFs containing images and text into fully editable .docx documents. It works 100% offline, does not require uploading your files to the cloud, and fully respects your privacy. Thanks to the pdf2docx library, it preserves the original layout 99.9%, although in some cases with non-RGB images or very complex layouts, there may be slight discrepancies.
features:
Features:

  • Convert .pdf documents to .docx
  • Graphical interface with Tkinter (no terminal dependency)
  • Easy to use, ideal for non-technical users
  • Open-source under MIT
  • Does not send your files to remote servers
  • Completely offline
  • Based on Python, extensible, and portable
how_use:
Ready to convert your PDFs to Word with a single click? PDF2WORDX leverages the power of pdf2docx and the lightweight Tkinter to offer you a smooth and simple experience.

Note: All commands must be executed from the project root. The main file is ./src/pdf2wordx/_pdf2wordx.py.

Installing locally: üíª

  1. Clone the repository:

  2. (Optional) Create a virtual environment:
    python -m venv .venv
  3. Install dependencies:
    pip install -r requirements.txt
  4. Run the app locally:

limits:
Limits

  • Large files (over 20 MB) may fail or take a long time to process
  • Images in non-RGB formats may cause conversion errors
  • Only one file can be converted at a time
known_bugs:
• Conversion error if the PDF contains non-RGB images
  • The interface may temporarily freeze during conversion (especially on Windows)
